channel.title: Need a little help
channel.description:
Ok, I need to find a way to find the red point:
[img]http://img292.imageshack.us/img292/4686/lineskh2.png[/img]
The only information I have is this:
The coordinates of the two black dots, and the depth.
The depth is the distance from the middle of the black line to the red point.
Also, the distances between each black dot and the red dot ( The grey lines ) have to be the same.
I've gotten close, but not there yet. If anyone could help me, I'd appreciate it.

item.title: Need a little help
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

Yes, I know how the Pythagoreans Theorem, but I can’t use it in this situation. In order to get the distance from the halfway mark of the black line to the red dot I need to know the coordinates of the red dot, but thats what I’m trying to figure out.

Sorry if I misread your post, and it actually does work, I don’t have much time. :\

Read full topic

item.title: Need a little help
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

a²+b²=c²

Pythagoreans Theorem. With Pythagoreans theorem you c is always The Hypotenuse (side opposite right angle.)
The Black Point in the farthest left corner will be represented by B1. The other Black Point is B2. The Red Point R.

For this question, I will give you what you need. What you half to do is split the triangle into two, so you have two right triangles.

a=Black point to Black Point divided by two. (A=Dist(B1,B2)/2)
b=Distance from Red point to half way between The Two Black Points (a). [B=Dist(R,A)]

Then you need to calculate a² (Multiply ‘a’ by itself.) Do the Same thing with b. Add the results together.

You will get a ridiculously high number. That is obviously not the answer. Find the square root of a²+b² (What I was just explaining) to find the answer of c. Now you have the side length of the Hypotenuse, or the distance between the black and red points.

Hope I explained it will!

Read full topic

item.title: Need a little help
item.dc:creator: @Infintry001 Infintry001
item.description:
@Infintry001 wrote:

I know that you find the midpoint of hte two dots, make a right angle, and extend that ray to the depth. Dont know how you would do that in SCAR though.

Read full topic
